channel.title: Comments on: Web2Ireland – what's going on – week ending June 13th

item.title: By: Web2Ireland - what’s going on - week ending June 13th - (2 of 2) | computerization
item.dc:creator: Web2Ireland - what’s going on - week ending June 13th - (2 of 2) | computerization
item.description: [...] 13th of June 2008 by Fergus Burns Folks seem to like these posts - so here’s some bits and bobs from around the Web2Ireland scene… Web2Ireland branding to improve with new logo - Thanks to all submissions and votes - the Web2Ireland community voted to an entry from Spoiltchild. Dial2Do announce deal with Jajah Irish and the iPhone Zignals launches … [Source: http://web2ireland.org]/ [...]
item.content:encoded: [...] 13th of June 2008 by Fergus Burns Folks seem to like these posts – so here’s some bits and bobs from around the Web2Ireland scene… Web2Ireland branding to improve with new logo – Thanks to all submissions and votes – the Web2Ireland community voted to an entry from Spoiltchild. Dial2Do announce deal with Jajah Irish and the iPhone Zignals launches … [Source: http://web2ireland.org/ [...]

item.title: By: Robin Blandford
item.dc:creator: Robin Blandford
item.description:
D4 Heroes!!!!! lol
I like the 4.
I was looking for a verb too- as the site works off subdomains...
BandonLifeboat.decisionsforheroes.com could be BandonLifeboat.logIncident.com
getLogs.com
getStats.com
liveRescues.com
ourRescues.com
item.content:encoded:
D4 Heroes!!!!! lol

I like the 4.

I was looking for a verb too- as the site works off subdomains…

BandonLifeboat.decisionsforheroes.com could be BandonLifeboat.logIncident.com

ourRescues.com

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description: d4h.com is gone and unfortunately d4heroes.com would probably be more suited to people in Kiely's in Donnybrook :-)
item.content:encoded: d4h.com is gone and unfortunately d4heroes.com would probably be more suited to people in Kiely’s in Donnybrook

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description: 500 followers? Surely you mean 5000 :-) The 5000th follower might win a Palm IIIx (currently broken).
item.content:encoded: 500 followers? Surely you mean 5000 The 5000th follower might win a Palm IIIx (currently broken).

item.title: By: Robin Blandford
item.dc:creator: Robin Blandford
item.description:
The domain is ghastly isn't it... 'decisions' and 'heroes' are both impossible spellings. Any suggestions for a 'shortcut' domain?
Finetuna is GREAT. And a great name. I specc'd this for http://www.imagefile.ie/ 1.5yrs ago as a rebrandable service for their clients but it went no further. Really glad someone has done it.
item.content:encoded:
The domain is ghastly isn’t it… ‘decisions’ and ‘heroes’ are both impossible spellings. Any suggestions for a ‘shortcut’ domain?

Finetuna is GREAT. And a great name. I specc’d this for http://www.imagefile.ie/ 1.5yrs ago as a rebrandable service for their clients but it went no further. Really glad someone has done it.
